content.question: A student performs an experiment in which the horizontal position of a toy car is recorded on ticker tape from a device that places dots on the tape in equal time intervals. The series of dots in the figure represents the motion of an object moving from the negative direction to the positive direction along the horizontal direction. The time interval between each recorded dot is <math alttext="1 second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following experiments could the student have conducted to create the data shown on the ticker tape?

choices.label: A toy car that initially increases its speed, travels at a constant speed, and then increases its speed again.
A toy car that initially increases its speed, travels at a constant speed, and then decreases its speed.
A toy car that initially decreases its speed, stops, and then increases its speed.
A toy car that initially decreases its speed, travels at a constant speed, and then increases its speed.

content.answer: A toy car that initially increases its speed, travels at a constant speed, and then decreases its speed.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
